comments:
Build: I20050308-1510

1) Make a change that causes a very long build (such as cleaning workspace).
2) While the build is running, go to the "Builders" property page for a project
3) Click New.
4) Select Ant build.  Click Ok.

Sometimes, but not always, this causes the following error to occur.  I was able
to get this to happen several times, but not every time:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed

Strange...the shell of the dialog page is disposed...

How I reproduced was to cancel the properties dialog after selecting a new Ant 
builder but before the launch configuration dialog was realized. 
The user operation was blocked by the background build and when that job got 
scheduled the shell was disposed.

Ouch. I suspect we have lots of code that is susceptable to just such a 
scenario

I can no longer reproduce this problem.
I can't seem to get into the "wait" state anymore.
